result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Denton Schmidt #374323 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew Denton Schmidt #374323 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew Denton Schmidt #374323 was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Matthew Denton Schmidt #374323 in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Defendant Matthew Denton Schmidt in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  943.10(1m)(a) amended Ct. to burglary as repeater.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty. Dolch makes statement.  DE makes alloquation.  Court withholds sentence.

Ct. 1: as AMENDED 943.10(1m)(a) burglary as repeater
40 mos. probation
90 days SCJ, w/work release, forthwith, concurrent to any other sentence and any other conditional jail
Submit to DNA Sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Participate and Comply with and completion of Sauk Co. Adult Drug Court
No contact w/any individual that is affiliated with a gang
